elements.title: killer toy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that precursors to the killer toy include ventriloquist dummies such as Otto (pictured) in the 1929 film The Great Gabbo?

elements.title: Sibil Pektorosoğlu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Armenian-Turkish soprano Sibil Pektorosoğlu released her first album after singing in a church choir for almost twenty years?

elements.title: logic translations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that logic translations can be used to analyze whether arguments expressed in ordinary language are correct?

elements.title: Council of Palm Oil Producing Countries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Indonesia and Malaysia founded the Council of Palm Oil Producing Countries to promote the use of palm oil?

elements.title: Elle Leonard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Meyers and Elle Leonard donated US$500,000 toward the renovation of the site of their first date?

elements.title: Self-Portrait (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that X-radiographs of Jan Lievens's circa 1629–1630 Self-Portrait showed that the artist made "transformative revisions to his appearance" in the portrait?

elements.title: Rachel Belden Brooks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rachel Belden Brooks was an African-American pioneer who was awarded $1,000 when she sued the estate of her previous enslaver?

elements.title: enjoy their narcotic effect (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that black lemurs use toxic millipede secretions as insect repellent, and apparently enjoy their narcotic effect?
